name: morbo
text: Exit Phillipe, stage right.

name: excusemesenator
text: Looks more like stage left to me.

name: tifunkalicious
text: technically stage left if they are, in fact, facing an audience on a stage

name: saulbellow
text:
From Introduction to New Characters 2010-2011

DeNeuve: Hi everybody, I'm Steve DeNeuve. If you're reading this in the voice of Philip Seymour Hoffman, you just lost the game.

name: razorman57
text: why did you kill my game-wnning streak? WHY?!

name: ratacattt
text: wow...that avatir...

name: aperson
text: Also, Pokemon!

name: thebigmike1983
text: Damn you!

name: gazdatronik
text: NO! Steve DeNeuve is from Brussels, Belgium. He emigrated to America in 1989. He sounds like Gérard Depardieu, but only slightly.

name: mangtastic
text: Do I not lose the game if Philip Seymour Hoffman was nowhere near my consciousness while reading this?

name: wozzeck
text: You do not.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Snagglepuss!

name: motu
text: Is this dude secretly Philippe's dad? Because he seems like he's secretly Philippe's dad.

name: excusemesenator
text: But he's not an otter!

name: granularsilica
text: Check the mouth -- this guy is an otter!

name: lexsenthur
text: He HAS been preparing for probably more than 24 hours. Guy's a pro, he knows his charge.

name: lateadopter
text:
Look at the hinkiness of the last strip. The phone call at 5:30 am, the last-minute switch of cars, waiting outside ahead of the scheduled pick-up time. The next strip, or the one after, will show the van showing up at 21 Achewood with the real Steve DeNeuve, and Teodor completely flipping out. Ray and/or Roast Beef have to ride to the rescue somehow.

This guy is probably an otter with cat-ear toupee, and Philippe's mom is a liar. Fits the pattern.

name: lonestar52
text: That's hella depressing.

name: hoarday4
text: I think it's probably more like a hull instead of a toupee. Look at the size of his skull. It's mega sized.

name: ratacattt
text: he has whatever is the opposite of a degenerative skull disease... his skull keeps growing and growing.. and the only way he can slow it down is by imbibing freshly liquidified child otters mixed with fresh fruit with the help of a giant juicer machine that he got off of the shopping channel.

name: fresco
text: Oh man look at the first panel with the car, the exhaust fumes aren't trailing out behind, they're going straight up! That car is not moving, ladies and gentlemen. I think that fake Steve fellow is in the car making the call. I fear for this otter.

name: ratacattt
text: shit!  I feel sorry for Teador is he got duped so easily.  It wouldn't be so bad for him if he didn't care about Phillip so much.  Onstad was not kind to Teador when he created him.

name: granularsilica
text: I musta missed that one.

name: speccer
text: Assuming those are his ears about 25 degrees from the top of his head, he is not an otter.

name: newspaperdrone
text: Nah, he's the guy that secretly lived in their attic for years. Every night he would exit the attic to lick Philippe's toys, then go back again. He thought it gave him sexual powers.

name: slackaholicus
text: Stop trying to ruin this moment. It is SPECIAL.

name: varnish
text:
Either that, or it is Nice Pete, and he is wearing Steve Deneuve.

These are rough chuckles.

name: wozzeck
text:
Possibly also that is a Subaru Brat, wearing an AMC Eagle.

We all know what that would mean...

name: snugelgguns
text:
Something's up with the car. While technically introduced in 1979, the first model of AMC Eagle was the 1980 model. Wiki that shit.

Furthermore, and more importantly, Roadwaste Stop-free In-motion Slopless Re-percolating Convenience Tanks can only be safely attached to the right passenger seat, the very place where Phillipe's strapped rear sleeper cozy is located!

Finally, I'm sure I'm not the only one to notice that "Steve Deneuve is an anagram of "Vet Eve Ensued." I don't have to tell you what that means.

name: spectre
text: Yes, hella Hell.

name: deus
text: NO! NOOO! i TRUST DENUVE I TRUST HIM WITH MY LIFE!

name: spectre
text: Well, of course we trtust him with YOUR life. We don't care about you. We care about Phillipe.

name: belgand
text: Well, in all fairness, it did.

name: linguine
text: I would like to know this as well

name: silvereyes
text: I would like to know how a ropey afghan differs from the non-ropey variety.

name: mkb
text: Compare a cable knit sweater to the non-cable knit variety

name: silvereyes
text: Now I own a cable knit sweater... damn you Internet shopping!

name: scorpio_nadir
text: A ropey afghan is the guy with dreads under his turban.

name: shineboxx
text: No, he's just that professional.

name: greenkoolayd
text: this was my first guess.

name: intergalactic_
text: His last name is of the French variety. Could very well be.

name: mangtastic
text: It could be spanish though.

name: omegatron
text: He works for The Mafia.   The Nice Mafia.

name: deus
text: Here comes a special dad!

name: excusemesenator
text: I have a bad feeling about this...

name: jaminspoon
text: I don't understand. He has a 5 star rating on Yelp.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Steve Denueuve's other job is he is a secret agent for the Queen.

name: intergalactic_
text: I do too. Maybe I've been watching too many old action movies recently but there's something off about him.

name: never_die
text: DeNeuve's hair looks like one of those optical illusion double pictures. i see a penguin OR a sleeping monster (where the rest of DeNeuve's face comprises the monster's comforter).

name: sigmacoder
text: Oh man, I totally see the sleeping dragon. I SEE IT WITH ALL OF MY EYES.

name: wingspan
text: Is Steve DeNeuve someone Philippe is safe with? It is not clear.

name: jaminspoon
text:
In time all will be revealed. Or also it might not be at all.
That is also something that is not clear.

name: m3tanoia
text: [IMGS OFF]

text: please fill in this post with the appropriate hilarious image

name: jaminspoon
text: If I close my eyes and face the North Star with all my heart , I can almost see it.

name: m3tanoia
text: :o

name: tifunkalicious
text: I have not seen a child containment device quite like the one phillipe is in

name: jaminspoon
text:
That is because you are expected to build it yourself, akin to a rite of passage.
You are not a father until you have duct-taped your child for their own safety.

name: maltese
text: so phillipe is a suicide baby? my. rough chuckles.

name: crom
text: I feel at ease with Steve DeNeuve. I would like him to drive me places. He seems really mellow, like Nice Pete but without, y'know, the seething murderous rage beneath the surface.

name: nagash
text: He has done a lot of study to make sure Phillipe feels good about this trip.

name: oldhusky
text: Steve DeNeuve pays attention

name: randyleepublic
text: Chub for PBF av.  The Jefferson Airplane and the Perry Bible Fellowship: things we miss.

name: titosmiley
text: I get the feeling this might not be just a simple return trip to Threadville...

name: jbgv
text: i'm happy with how quickly this story is turning into a weird david lynch film.

name: barrymorefm
text: i'm sad that steve deneuve looks like an unconfirmed mammal version of kevin costner in the bodyguard to me and probably only me.

name: mabel
text: i was thinking george kennedy in cool hand luke.

name: zhankfor
text: As opposed to the other kind of David Lynch film.

name: belgand
text: All Achewood stories turn into either David Lynch or David Cronenberg stories. There is really no other way.

name: fresco
text: Steve doesn't just transport the animal. He studies the animal's past life, and reminds them of good things so that the package gets to the location happy and eager to be there. Ain't nothing worse than a finnicky, scared animal in a new location. Steve DeNeuve knows this, because Steve DeNeuve is a PROFESSIONAL.

name: nice-on-water
text: I PICKED THE WRONG FUCKING TIME TO GO ON HIATUS LET ME TELL YOU.

name: mattylite
text: Looks like I picked the wrong day to stop sniffing glue.

name: streever
text: Everything is OK as long as you picked up huffing paint.

name: belgand
text:
I have some latex paint, can I use that instead?

"I was painting the garage and I wanted to know if latex would bond to stucco so I thought I'd do a 'search' for, oh, I don't know 'latex bondage'".

name: smilebuddha
text: A primer on latex paint, eh?

name: hyetal
text:
Since this is Achewood, I assume that Steve will safely transport Philippe to his mother where he'll live in happiness and security for the rest of his days.

Or, we're being primed for some really weird shit to start happening.

Or continue happening.

name: sonofkong
text: I'm not sure what these feelings are, but boy am I feeling them, and hard .

name: jaminspoon
text:
About the possible dangers and backstory of Steve DeNeuve, or seeing a 5 year-old otter bondage-locked into a plastic transport crate.
Your answer will carry gravity, so do not hesitate.

name: mockereo
text: reaction time is a factor, Leon.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ...which is what she said.

name: bill4935
text: I'm starting to have a bad feeling about this, Scoob old buddy.

text: It is a thing to have sufficient firepower in your underwear.

name: smallblackdog
text: That Roadkill is slowly coalescing.

name: jaminspoon

name: cpnglxynchos

text: Now where is that Super-Secret Ice Cream Shop?

text: Right where you left it Jeff

name: belgand
text: At the same time he really did take him to an ice cream shop that was incredibly out of the way. He didn't get to known as Nice Pete by being a dick.

name: srikamaraja
text: I hope that Steve is a good man. I am beginning to trust him. But to trust someone with Phillippe... Well, there must be a reason Tacodor hired him.

name: philophobe
text: Somewhat inexplicably, I cannot help but imagine Philippe as Michael Douglas in The Game . If Steve DeNeuve turns out to be either a clown doll with a camera in his mouth, or Sean Penn, I will seriously lose my shit.

text: Well, it was worth a try.  Just imagine Philippe with the porkchop and applesauce from that one strip, but turned into ASCII art by some crappy web-based ascii art generator.

name: lateadopter
text:
mattylite, I thought of this a while back, but could not do it. I chubbied you until my chubby was reduced to a nub that was no longer allowed to be friendly. That was only twice, I'm afraid.

I think the problem is that AssetBar eliminates all double spaces, so your white space is gone, and you are left with sludge of outline and texture characters on your left margin. Still life with, Philippe, pork chop, and high-G acceleration.

name: ratacattt
text: it's basically phillippe inside the juicer

name: puguglypress
text: Oh man, and I thought

name: puguglypress
text: (that I was pressing "BBcode" instead of "post", apparently)

name: shinkusan
text: The computers are taking over. This proves it.

name: expellens
text: Steve DeNeuve seems to think very highly of himself.  Where I come from, this is considered a dick thing to do.

name: expellens
text: He's also dropping some major hints paternity wise to a 5 year old otter.  This too is considered a dick move.

name: expellens
text: The implication being that a cat boned an otter 5 or so years ago.

name: granularsilica
text: But Steve's not a cat.  Check out the mouth, and why can't we see his hands (flippers) on the steering wheel?

name: i_love_kate
text:
I'm relatively sure the two of them are in the back seat. There's something to the right of the Steve DeNeuve panels that looks like it might be the back of the front seat, and in some panels the speech bubbles (especially Philippe's) seem to be indicating the two rear seats. I am under the impression that Steve DeNeuve does not fill the position of driver on this journey, he is simply there to ensure the safety and comfort of the otter.

He probably has a gun somewhere within easy reach inside the car.

name: milesdonovan
text: Correct.  From the previous comic: "Our driver is 2 blocks away with Mr. DeNeuve..."

name: ratacattt
text: well aren't you just special because you have an attention span.

name: carlyle
text: It's an increasingly rare thing today.

name: ratacattt
text: tell me about it.  I have to take medication to even have half an attention span

name: carlyle
text: Damn. I have to take meds just to focus it on school, but you need them to actually have one.

name: streever
text:
Steve is not an otter. Man, look at his ears. You really misjudged this. It's almost like that time you showed up at the dance with no underwear on.

(It was only a dream. OR WAS IT?

name: granularsilica
text: It was okay not having underear on -- until she aroused me!

name: streever
text:
Look at his ears, man. No Otter has ears like that.

You've completely misjudged the situation. Wow, this is embarrassing. It's like that time you showed up at school in your underwear. But that was only a dream, wasn't it?

WASN'T IT?

name: streever
text: it wasn't.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Haha, I always feel really embarrassed when that happens to me.

...I'm sorry, man.

name: wjon
text: Phillipe is still in Ray mode. I don't like his necklace, it makes me wonder how it stays where it is, as the otter lacks a defined neck and shoulders.

name: raticus
text: Someone figured it out the first time it showed up - it loops around the back of his ears and connects to the back of his glasses.

name: i_love_kate
text: It was conjecture at the time, now it is an observable fact.

name: wjon
text: I am full of shame that I did not know this.

name: granularsilica
text: Thanks for taking the shame for the rest of us know-nothings.

name: wjon
text: And, yet, no chubbies.

name: ratacattt
text: the glasses are stapled to his skull

name: belgand
text: Because you're viciously anti-Catholic. That's why.

text:
I'm a tad concerned...

[IMGS OFF]

text: Gosh darn it. This is what I meant to post: [url=http://imgur.com/BeYxC.jpg]Doesn't he look like Philip Seymour Hoffman from "Doubt?"[/img]

text: You know what. NEVER MIND.

name: miku224
text: I definitely see it.  Good eye!

name: belgand
text: And yet you're the one who makes me see things. Truly it is a perplexing universe.

name: wjon
text: I gave you a chubby. I also gave you a lame. This expresses my feelings on this subjects.

name: jaminspoon
text: That is deep in the mains.

name: tyrannorocks
text: Wouldn't you get more firepower from a smaller set of underwear elastic? You would have to stretch the larger pair further to get the same snap. I know this is a quibbling point, but bear with me as I get out my charts and write my elastic underwear crossbow formulas on the chalkboard...

name: nher
text: No, you twist/roll the longer one to a thicker thingy and get more power.

name: belgand
text: More power DIRECTLY from the thingy.

name: yearofglad
text:
I'm getting:

R=4((V*E*(dl^2))/(M*L^2*g))*sin(2*theta)

Where R is the range, V volume of the strap, E the young's modulus of elastic, dl the total stretch, L the length of underwear strap, M mass of crossbow bolt, theta the firing angle, and g the gravitational acceleration (on earth, or wherever Philippe happens to be). Using some rough estimates, here is a graph of Philippe's crossbow plotted as range vs distance pulled back (in meters):

http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=4*((.01*.001*.15).001*10^9*(x%2F.25)^2%2F.01)%2F9.8 from 0 to .1

What a little warrior!

name: mockereo
text: your avatar is absolutely appropriate

name: belgand
text: And combine with his username the implication is that Gladi is actually quite intelligent. Or at least skilled at analytical dynamics.

text:

....cleary this means that Steve DeNeuve must be a Communist.

I'm watching you, Steve DeNeuve. I'M WATCHING YOU!

name: neonfreon
text:
i feel bad because i've been home and i know the beige dinner plates with dark brown oak leaves and acorns painted around the edges aren't there anymore

i am mournful because i know there is no way to go back home, and that all you can do is make a new home for a new child

i know these truths so deeply that i can't believe it could be any different for phillipe the 5 year old otter

i'm also concerned that steve deneuve is really gary busey

name: belgand
text:
It's a good idea to be concerned that any man might actually be Gary Busey in disguise. That is the sort of thing he does.

The extra caution is worth the social awkwardness.

name: epicurus
text: ratacatt: Man writes impassioned rant against discrimination, closes by suggesting that his opponent suck his dick as punishment for an incorrect opinion.

name: shelbydavis
text: A pedantic point, but one I figure you'll appreciate:  what you call racism or jubahubadism is probably more appropriately called chauvinism.

name: ratacattt
text:
SWEET JESUS yes you are right that's an awesome word and I can't believe I didn't know it! I'm happy to have discovered it. I always assumed it was used only to mean 'male chauvinist.' That's an awesome word. I can't wait for my first opportunity to berate someone with it!

Shit, I'm Pat.

Etymology

From French chauvinisme (originally %u2018idealistic devotion to Napoleon%u2019), named from Nicolas Chauvin de Rochefort, a soldier of the First Republic known for his excessive patriotism, especially famous after featuring as a character in Cogniard's play La Cocarde Tricolore.
[edit] Pronunciation

* (RP) IPA: /%u02C8%u0283%u0259%u028A.v%u026A.n%u026A.z%u0259m/, SAMPA: /"S@U.vI.nI.z@m/
* (US) IPA: /'%u0283o%u028A.v%u0259%u02CCn%u026Azm%u0329/, SAMPA: /"SoU.v@.nI.z@m/
* (Australia) IPA: /%u02C8%u0283%u0259%u028A.v%u0259.n%u026A.z%u0259m/, SAMPA: /"S@U.v@.nI.z@m/

[edit] Noun
Wikipedia-logo.png
Wikipedia has an article on:
Chauvinism

Singular
chauvinism


Plural
countable and uncountable; plural chauvinisms

chauvinism (countable and uncountable; plural chauvinisms)

1. Excessive patriotism, eagerness for national superiority; jingoism.
2. Unwarranted bias, favoritism, or devotion to one's own particular group, cause, or idea.

Feminists say that male chauvinism is still prevalent in cultures worldwide.

[edit] Synonyms

* jingoism

[edit] Derived terms

* male chauvinist

[edit] Related terms

* chauvinist

text: Paaatttttt. It's okay to come out of the closet about being an asshole.

text: Being an asshole is like a sandy beach, and we have to learn not to go there!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Obvious troll is obvious.

name: desert_donkey
text: i hope they both die.

name: epicurus
text: Okay listen. Is Steven DeNeuve driving or is he sitting in the back with Philippe or what?

name: wingspan
text: I vote in the back with Philippe. In the previous strip Johnny Phone Calls tells Tacodor the driver is two blocks away with Mr. DeNeuve.

name: flateric
text: Also note the direction of Philippe's inquisitive look in panel five vis-à-vis the back seat.

name: quantumcasaba
text: "the driver" == Mr. DeNeuve! "What a twist!"

name: i_love_kate
text: Man I covered this.

name: neonfreon
text: Correct. From the previous comic: "Our driver is 2 blocks away with Mr. DeNeuve..."

name: dongleaid
text: assetbar imitates assetbar

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Onstad could spring anyone as the driver. Cartilage Head....Nice Pete...anyone....

name: belgand
text:
I was assuming that their driver was there to deliver Mr. DeNeuve who would not, of course, be driving himself to the meet. He is a professional and it is his job to drive Phillipe. He's not wasting himself on getting there.

Based on a more detailed view of the strip and the dialogue balloons though it would appear that I am wrong.

name: granularsilica
text: If you knew ANYTHING about high-security animal transport, you'd know someone has to be with the beast AT ALL TIMES. No driving allowed.  Now keep an eye on that badger for me while I have a smoke.

name: gladi8orrex
text:
Teh road is long,
the pavement: rough
you may bring along:
your cherished stuff

I cannot see it yet.
your destination,
I am glad we met;
let us go:
without hesitation

the road is dark,
the street is narrow.
why don't we talk?
about your bow and arrow

i can see it now, faintly
in the distance. not much
further; i remember distinctly
i hope you've not forgotten--
how it feels: your mothers touch

the road is bumpy and unpave'
we drive along in caution
since you've seen your mother wave,
or smell your cloths after her:-
careful, loving , washin'

I can see it now, clear as day
a gasp upon beholding, like a
human child; first beholding rome
the thrilled cries, the teared up eyes,
a rush out the door:-his toys: he forgot some
he hurries to hug his dear mother. my heart: it dies
when the otter finally is home

name: gladi8orrex
text:
LINE EDIT

there is a missing line. damnit, i thought it but didn't write it i am so sorry

it was before 'since you've seen your...' it would be sumthin like how long's it been. goddamnit

name: gladi8orrex
text: damn there is actually more to edit i rly shoulda reread this one i fucked up

name: i_love_kate
text: Did you make a new account to repeatedly lame yourself?

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
s'okay, glad. I like the double-entendre of this line:

Quote:
I am glad we met;


Unintentional? I think not.

name: deus
text: I...I could trust this man with my life!

name: carlyle
text: I like this Steve guy. Seems nice enough to me.

name: ratacattt
text: something

name: duperando
text: I kind of feel like Steve DeNeuve is sort of supposed to be like a Russel Crowe-type character. He has this intense look about him. Sort of circa "A Beautiful Mind" with the slightly obsessive way he tries to comfort Phillippe.

name: belgand
text: I can't fully explain it, but I'm getting a youngish Walter Matthau vibe.

name: pygmalion00
text:
What I want to know


is where Onstad comes up with all the names for his minor characters.

See:
Steve DeNeuve
Leo Fontanette
Bob Calcavecchio (nonexistent, but work with me here)
et. al.

name: wingspan
text: The Police Blotter from 1950's back-issues of the Brooklyn Gazette?

name: zhankfor
text: From business cards he finds taped to Halloween candy.

name: streever
text: chubbied for your ability to pay attention!

name: johnnyrocker
text: flipping to random pages in the phonebook?

name: gladi8orrex
text: prob his imagination you dumb son of a bitch

name: stonecrab
text: My favorite is, well not actually a character, but "Rockford Fosgate" - name of the business Showbiz owes money to... Makes me want to open a business, just so I can name it "Rockford Fosgate".

name: missbee
text:
Why did he wait until they were on the road to introduce himself?
This makes me uneasy.

name: i_love_kate
text:
I thought that. He seems to have a precisely calculated moment at a certain point of the journey at which to first turn towards his charge and introduce himself.

In his head, he is now counting down to the time of the next Interaction.

name: missbee
text: I can see that. Wow, super creepy.

name: berami
text:
Poor little Phillipe... he looks so eager and trusting. I haven't felt this scared for him since the Secret Ice Cream Store.
I do like that he now has a little chain on his sunglasses, though.
I gave this one a 4 even though 1 matches my expression better.

name: mockereo
text: teach me your ways! i still can't rate strips since the 1337 hax that abused them

name: streever
text: He was safe at the Secret Ice Cream Store, and he'll be safe with Steve DeNeuve. Don't worry so much, it'll make you turn grey.

name: theirateturk
text: Home. Home Again. (I like to be here when I can).

name: caddon
text: Last line's from an alternative Gil Scott-Heron track lost to the ages.

name: mockereo
text:
i doubt Gil Scott-Heron funked out about underwear elastic crossbows...

oooooh you mean the last last line

name: randyleepublic
text: Phillipe, I'm a prostitute.

name: thinman
text:
You're a prostitute, or Steve DeNeuve is?

Because I think Steve DeNeuve would refer to himself as a 'purveyor of coital friction.'

Cuz that seems like the kind of guy Steve DeNueve would be.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Oh my gosh. What about Petunia and the baby? I'll be a two-timer! I'll go to hell!

name: mintyhelminthes
text: so beautiful

text: There goes a special boy

name: granularsilica
text:
Okay, this much is certain:
1. Steve is in the back seat w/ Philippe
2. Steve has ears, therefore, is not an otter
3. Someone else is driving

name: esselfortium
text: "I think...I may have been born to meet you, Philippe."

name: junebuggy
text: Has anyone noticed that Steve DeNeuve's collar spells Korn?

name: i_love_kate
text: That is the most improbable subliminal advertising that has ever been.

name: mockereo
text:
probably the most inappropriate too...

Everyone: ( stage whisper ) What is the purpose of that ellipses at the end of his sentence fragment?

Mockereo: It serves as a challenge to everyone to find hilarious examples. I'm so glad you asked me, Everyone.
